oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. James Long, Co. E, 5th Ky. Cav., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. James Long, Co. E, 5th Ky. Cav., USA, to his friend Amos. He writes of supplies finally arriving and the effect it had on morale. Mentions "The rumor still persists that Gen. Grant is going to take charge of affairs in this department. Everyone is wondering why we have been inactive so long." He talks of the Confederate artillery barrage and that he had a bullet pass through the skirt of his jacket on a scouting expedition.
